refnamediv.refname: RFC CDK #15: What IO should and should not do

refsect1.title: Proposal
refsect1.para: This proposal defines how IO classes should behave and be written. The guidelines below are written for readers, but apply to writers too: when reading "reading from" this also includes "writing to", etc.

The IO class should:
implement CDK's ChemObjectReader
read all information from the file that the JavaDoc mentions it reads
define all information it reads from file in the class' JavaDoc
flush the writer after finishing the writing
read everything the corresponding CDK writer can output
write everything the corresponding CDK reader can read

The IO class should *not*:
expect any information in the file other than actually stated in the file. It may implement knowledge not given in the file, but stated in the file format's specification. Thus, it must not expect "C" to be carbons unless the specification says so.
close the Reader after done reading

refsect1.title: Reason
refsect1.para: The IO classes seems to use these guidelines, but it is nice to have them written down somewhere. (And a RFC is the place then).
